Welcome to the VNIT Housing Price Prediction project documentation. This comprehensive guide covers the complete machine learning pipeline including data preprocessing, exploratory data analysis, model optimization, and deployment.


\chapter{Project Overview}
\label{\detokenize{index:project-overview}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
The VNIT Housing Price Prediction project is an end\sphinxhyphen{}to\sphinxhyphen{}end machine learning solution that predicts house prices using advanced regression techniques. The project implements best practices in data science including:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Data Preprocessing \& EDA} \sphinxhyphen{} Comprehensive data cleaning and exploration

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Hyperparameter Optimization} \sphinxhyphen{} Optuna\sphinxhyphen{}based parameter tuning

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Model Training} \sphinxhyphen{} XGBoost with cross\sphinxhyphen{}validation

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Experiment Tracking} \sphinxhyphen{} MLflow for reproducibility

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Performance Monitoring} \sphinxhyphen{} Evidently for model health checks

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Workflow Orchestration} \sphinxhyphen{} Prefect for pipeline management

\end{itemize}

\sphinxstylestrong{Run Preprocessing Pipeline}:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
===============================================
VNIT Housing Price Prediction
===============================================

.. image:: https://img.shields.io/badge/Python\PYGZhy{}3.8+\PYGZhy{}blue.svg
.. image:: https://img.shields.io/badge/License\PYGZhy{}MIT\PYGZhy{}green.svg

Welcome to the VNIT Housing Price Prediction project documentation. This comprehensive guide covers the complete machine learning pipeline including data preprocessing, exploratory data analysis, model optimization, and deployment.

Project Overview
================

The VNIT Housing Price Prediction project is an end\PYGZhy{}to\PYGZhy{}end machine learning solution that predicts house prices using advanced regression techniques. The project implements best practices in data science including:

\PYGZhy{} **Data Preprocessing \PYGZam{} EDA** \PYGZhy{} Comprehensive data cleaning and exploration
\PYGZhy{} **Hyperparameter Optimization** \PYGZhy{} Optuna\PYGZhy{}based parameter tuning
\PYGZhy{} **Model Training** \PYGZhy{} XGBoost with cross\PYGZhy{}validation
\PYGZhy{} **Experiment Tracking** \PYGZhy{} MLflow for reproducibility
\PYGZhy{} **Performance Monitoring** \PYGZhy{} Evidently for model health checks
\PYGZhy{} **Workflow Orchestration** \PYGZhy{} Prefect for pipeline management

Key Metrics
===========

\PYGZhy{} **Model R\(\sp{\text{2}}\) Score**: 0.8990
\PYGZhy{} **RMSE**: \PYGZdl{}27,836.04
\PYGZhy{} **MAE**: \PYGZdl{}17,279.64
\PYGZhy{} **Optimization Trials**: 50 (Optuna)
\PYGZhy{} **Cross\PYGZhy{}Validation Folds**: 5

Quick Start
===========

1. **Install Dependencies**::

    pip install \PYGZhy{}r requirements.txt

2. **Run Preprocessing Pipeline**::

    cd src/preprocessing
    python preprocessing.py ../../data/train.csv

3. **Train Model**::

    cd src/modeling
    python modeling.py

4. **Launch Streamlit App**::

    streamlit run src/app/streamlit\PYGZus{}app.py

Project Structure
=================

::

    VNIT\PYGZus{}project/
    ├── data/                          \PYGZsh{} Dataset files
    │   ├── train.csv                  \PYGZsh{} Training data
    │   ├── test.csv                   \PYGZsh{} Test data
    │   ├── X\PYGZus{}train.csv                \PYGZsh{} Preprocessed features
    │   └── data\PYGZus{}description.txt       \PYGZsh{} Feature descriptions
    ├── models/                        \PYGZsh{} Trained models
    │   └── xgboost\PYGZus{}model.joblib       \PYGZsh{} Serialized XGBoost model
    ├── src/
    │   ├── preprocessing/             \PYGZsh{} Data preprocessing modules
    │   │   ├── preprocessing.py       \PYGZsh{} Preprocessing pipeline
    │   │   ├── monitoring.py          \PYGZsh{} Data quality monitoring
    │   │   └── EDADataPreProcessing.ipynb
    │   ├── modeling/                  \PYGZsh{} Model training modules
    │   │   ├── modeling.py            \PYGZsh{} Model pipeline
    │   │   └── Modeling.ipynb
    │   ├── app/                       \PYGZsh{} Streamlit application
    │   │   └── streamlit\PYGZus{}app.py
    │   └── mlruns/                    \PYGZsh{} MLflow experiment tracking
    ├── docs/                          \PYGZsh{} Documentation
    ├── Dockerfile                     \PYGZsh{} Docker configuration
    ├── docker\PYGZhy{}compose.yml             \PYGZsh{} Docker Compose setup
    └── requirements.txt               \PYGZsh{} Python dependencies

Features
========

\(\checkmark\) **Automated Data Pipeline** \PYGZhy{} End\PYGZhy{}to\PYGZhy{}end preprocessing with Prefect
\(\checkmark\) **Hyperparameter Optimization** \PYGZhy{} Optuna integration for parameter tuning
\(\checkmark\) **Experiment Tracking** \PYGZhy{} MLflow for model versioning and comparison
\(\checkmark\) **Data Quality Monitoring** \PYGZhy{} Evidently for drift detection
\(\checkmark\) **Model Evaluation** \PYGZhy{} Comprehensive metrics and validation
\(\checkmark\) **Production Ready** \PYGZhy{} Docker support and API deployment
\(\checkmark\) **Documentation** \PYGZhy{} Complete Sphinx documentation with examples

Technologies Used
=================

\PYGZhy{} **ML Framework**: XGBoost
\PYGZhy{} **Hyperparameter Tuning**: Optuna
\PYGZhy{} **Experiment Tracking**: MLflow
\PYGZhy{} **Workflow Orchestration**: Prefect
\PYGZhy{} **Data Quality**: Evidently
\PYGZhy{} **Data Processing**: Pandas, NumPy, Scikit\PYGZhy{}learn
\PYGZhy{} **Visualization**: Matplotlib, Seaborn
\PYGZhy{} **Deployment**: Streamlit, Docker

Performance
===========

The final XGBoost model achieves excellent performance on the test set:

\PYGZhy{} **R\(\sp{\text{2}}\) Score**: 0.8990 (explains 89.90\PYGZpc{} of variance)
\PYGZhy{} **Root Mean Squared Error**: \PYGZdl{}27,836
\PYGZhy{} **Mean Absolute Error**: \PYGZdl{}17,280
\PYGZhy{} **Training Samples**: 1,168
\PYGZhy{} **Test Samples**: 292
